pages.title: Steam Turbine
pages.text: The <item>Steam Turbine/$ is a way of making <thing>$(l:intro/rotary)rotary power/$ using <thing>$(l:intro/heat)heat/$. The other way to do this is with a <item>$(l:heat/stirling)stirling engine/$.$(br2)A <item>Steam Turbine/$ consumes <thing>$(l:fluid/steam)steam/$ and makes <thing>distilled water/$ and power. <thing>$(l:fluid/steam)Steam/$ goes in the bottom, <thing>distilled water/$ comes out the sides, and an axle or gear can be connected
to the top. An equal amount of <thing>distilled water/$ is produced as <thing>$(l:fluid/steam)steam/$ is consumed.

Compared to the <item>$(l:heat/stirling)stirling engine/$, the <item>steam turbine/$ has no maximum speed and is more scalable, but is less efficient and is bigger to set up. The <item>steam turbine/$ is usually better if a lot of power or high speeds are needed.
